content: a crochet pattern by sachiko burgin granny pineapple trivet size approx 25 5 cm / 10 tall and 16 5 cm/ 6½ wide at widest point yarn estelle yarns sudz tonal and solids crafting cotton worsted weight 100% cotton 74m / 80yds per 50g ball/skein shade mc - mustard q53910 1 skein and cc - leprechaun q53927 1 skein hook 4 50 mm / g - 7 hook gauge 14 chain = 10 cm / 4 long with 4 50 mm / g - 7 hook gauge is not essential in this pattern - see note below note with specified yarn quantity you may have enough yarn to make two trivets if above gauge is achieved beginning ch3 of row counts as a double_crochet and is refered to as a turning chain first double_crochet means the double_crochet at the base of ch3 pattern uses us crochet terminology © sachiko burgin 2022 https //kshandknitdesign com pattern is for personal use copy and images cannot be reproduced or distributed without consent page 1 of 2 pattern with mc ch12 skip first chain single_crochet in next 11 chain t ~ 11 single_crochet row 1 right side ch3 turning chain counts as a double_crochet 2dc in first single_crochet ch1 skip 1 single_crochet 3dc in next single_crochet ch1 4 times skip 1 single_crochet 3dc in last single_crochet t ~ 6 groups of 3dc row 2 ch3 double_crochet in first double_crochet ch1 3dc in next chain space 5 times ch1 2dc in 3rd chain of turning chain t row 3 ch3 3dc in next chain space ch1 5 times 3dc in next chain space double_crochet in 3rd chain of turning chain t repeat row 2 and 3 2 more times and then work row 2 once more row 9 ch3 double_crochet in first double_crochet skip first chain space and 3dc 3dc in next chain space ch1 4 times 2dc in 3rd chain of turning chain t ~ 4 groups of 3dc bordered by a group of 2dc on each end row 10 ch3 double_crochet in in first double_crochet skip first chain space and 3dc 3dc in next chain space ch1 3 times 2dc in 3rd chain of turning chain t ~ 3 groups of 3dc bordered by a group of 2dc on each end row 11 ch3 double_crochet chain space 2dc in 3rd chain of turning chain do not turn do not break yarn edging rotate work 90 degrees so that you will be working around outer edge single_crochet 2dc single_crochet into side of double_crochet single_crochet in side of turning chain 5 times 3sc in side of double_crochet single_crochet in each of next 11 chain from foundation chain 3sc in side of turning chain single_crochet
